docs.lead_paragraph: Mary Hartman, who is in a mental clinic recovering from a nervous breakdown, might be cheered to know that, starting tomorrow, the second year of her show will be shown on 125 independent stations reaching a potential audience of 55 million households, and that her stepfather, TV producer Norman Lear, expects to make up the program's first-year loss of $1.2 million.

headline.main: MH2 recycles our garbage; No longer merely a spoof of soap opera, 'Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman' begins its second year already enshrined as a cultural signpost.

docs.abstract: Ted Morgan article on success of program; producer Norman Lear comments; illus (M)
